definition: after one's heart (idiom); gratifying and satisfactory/everything one could wish

sentences.english: I took one guiltily, lit it and smoked with satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 我内疚地接过一枝点上，心称心足地抽起来。

sentences.english: Describe a time when a problem wast resolved to your satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 描写你对于疑难题目的措置惩罚不称心的一次履历。

sentences.english: Sunday well-spent brings a week of content.
sentences.chinese: 充实度过的星期天带来称心如意的一周。

sentences.english: The old man spent his old age in contentment.
sentences.chinese: 那位老人晚年过得很称心。

sentences.english: To be happy, we must have enjoyable leisure time and satisfying work.
sentences.chinese: 要幸福就得有闲遐，就得有称心的工作。

sentences.english: Didn't expect so JiJie not gratified, and still not plans for the cover.
sentences.chinese: 没想到季洁照样不称心，而且还不计划拍封面了。

sentences.english: "not fine to me, " shouted a large surly woman in the back .
sentences.chinese: “我可不称心，”背后一个脸色阴沉的胖女人大声喊。

sentences.english: and it seems like everything's lining up in my favor.
sentences.chinese: 每一件事都很称心如意，我就觉得非常幸运。
小孩子嗬嗬做声表示称心满意。

sentences.english: The compensations for the injuries seldom yield complete satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 伤害赔偿很少使受害人称心如意。

sentences.english: Higher English level will help you to find a satisfactory job in the future.
sentences.chinese: 英语程度高会在未来有助于你找到一份称心的工作。

sentences.english: I regard them as my most agreeable companion.
sentences.chinese: 我把它们看作是我最称心如意的伴侣。

sentences.english: So, the student satisfaction is very important.
sentences.chinese: 所以，学生的称心度长短常主要的。

sentences.english: Mr. Xia was born into a family of educationalists. He once had a very satisfying job in China.
sentences.chinese: 出身教育世家的夏先生，在国内曾有一份称心的工作。

sentences.english: Happiness is a state of fullness which is both pleasant and satisfying.
sentences.chinese: 幸福是一种圆满的状态，心满意足，称心又如意。

definition: after one's heart (idiom); gratifying and satisfactory/everything one could wish
to suit one's taste/suitable/congenial/by mutual agreement
as one wants/according to one's wishes/ruyi scepter, a symbol of power and good fortune
variant of 稱心|称心[chen4 xin1]
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥貼|妥贴[tuo3 tie1]
to know whether others are cold or hot (idiom)/to be very considerate
